thread.title: Istanbul nightclub attacker caught by police reports
thread.title_full: Istanbul nightclub attacker caught by police reports

title: Istanbul nightclub attacker caught by police reports
text:
Istanbul nightclub attacker caught by police: reports 40 reading now twitter TWEET More 
The man who killed 39 people in a shooting at an Istanbul nightclub in the early hours of New Year's Day has been caught by police, local media reports. 
Hurriyet newspaper reported that the attacker, named in local reports as Abdulkadir Masharipov, was caught in Esenyurt, Istanbul. Istanbul nightclub shooter arrested Istanbul nightclub shooter arrested 
Abdulkadir Masharipov, the man suspected of killing 39 people at an Istanbul nightclub in the early hours of New Year's Day has been captured. Vision courtesy: ABC News 24 . Up Next Lewis: 'Never, ever hate' Lewis: 'Never, ever hate' 
In his first public comments since getting into a war of words with Donald Trump, John Lewis honors the legacy of Martin Luther King, Jr. by telling a crowd in Miami to, "never, ever hate." Up Next A watch made from cheese for $25,780? Play Video A watch made from cheese for $25,780? A watch made from cheese for $25,780? 
A Swiss watch maker unveils a timepiece made from cheese to show that Switzerlandâs new labelling rules on âSwiss-Madeâ goods are too lenient. Up Next What happens on Inauguration Day Play Video What happens on Inauguration Day What happens on Inauguration Day 
Set your alarm early Saturday to watch the Donald Trump pledge the oath sworn by all 44 US presidents as part of three days of traditional ceremony. Up Next Skiers missing at Japanese ski resort Play Video Skiers missing at Japanese ski resort Skiers missing at Japanese ski resort 
Rescuers are searching for an Australian woman and her three sons at the Nozawa Onsen ski resort in Japan after they failed to return from a day of skiing. Vision courtesy ABC News 24 Up Next Dozens killed in Kyrgyzstan plane crash Play Video Dozens killed in Kyrgyzstan plane crash 
A Turkish cargo jet crashes near Kyrgyzstan's Manas airport killing at least 37 people. Up Next Merkel: Europe's fate is in its own hands Play Video Merkel: Europe's fate is in its own hands 
After Trump's Brexit remarks, German Chancellor Angela Merkel says Europe's fate is in its own hands. More videos Istanbul nightclub shooter arrested 
Abdulkadir Masharipov, the man suspected of killing 39 people at an Istanbul nightclub in the early hours of New Year's Day has been captured. Vision courtesy: ABC News 24 . 
The man, who media quoted police as saying had operated under the cover name Abu Muhammed Horasani, was caught in a hideout with his four-year-old son, Hurriyet said. The reports could not immediately be confirmed. 
Horasani was described as being of Uzbek origin by the Haberturk website, which said he was caught at a housing complex in Esenyurt district, on the European side of the city. Related Content Istanbul nightclub attack: victims came from at least 11 countries 
There were three people in the apartment where he was caught, the home of a Kyrgyz friend of his to which he had gone three days earlier, Haberturk said. 
According to state-run Anadolu news agency, five people were detained in the operation, including the alleged perpetrator, a man of Kyrgyz origin and three women. It said simultaneous raids were being conducted on other cells linked to the group. Advertisement 
Dogan news agency published what it said was the first image of the attacker. It showed a bruised, black-haired man in a grey, bloodied shirt being held by his neck. Private NTV television said the gunman had resisted arrest. 
Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was revenge for Turkish military involvement in Syria. SHARE
